page.title: 06Housing,Sherburn-in-Elmet.
page.content: {Population and Housing in Sherburn.} Since the census of 1971 Sherburn has grown considerably. In 1971 there were 3,235 people in Sherburn,living mainly in houses around the Harold Mills Centre,Beechwood Estate,Moor Lane,Finkle Hill,Kirkgate,Wolsey Croft and Highfields.In the 1981 census the populationhd risen by 1,305 to 4,540.This is because during the years 1973-77 Faircloughs built an estate at Eversley Park.In 1981 there were 917 private houses and 644 council houses.Since 1981 even more building has taken place.A Barratt estate called the Hedgerow has been built off Moor Lane.113 houses have been built and 99 have been sold.A new council estate has been built off Moor Lane called Pinfold estate and also some more council houses have been built behind the Social Club.
